review_title: An okay job for people who like to sit all day
job_title: Patient Companion in Daytona Beach, FL
pros: This job had some days which were very easy, such as when I had a patient who slept all day. The employees were very kind.
cons: The patients could sometimes be a handful- I got screamed at and spit on some days. The nurses often weren't aware of my job description and would ask me to do things that I was not allowed to do according to my contract. There was not a reliable lunch switchoff system, so I often would be forgotten about and not get to go to lunch until 3pm.

job_title: Dietary Aide in Daytona Beach, FL
pros: If you have absolutely no other obligations in your life, the pay could be considered decent. Because they will let you work 24/7 if you want.
cons: Absolutely everything. The job is so painfully simple, yet there isn’t a second that goes by where someone in management/a supervisor isn’t complaining. There’s no respect for employees from the management, and there’s no respect from the employees to the management. It’s pathetic. Dealing with the patients at a public hospital is horrible, but that’s expected. You’d think that all the coworkers/teams/departments would be even more likely to be positive with each other because they’re all dealing with angry patients, but no, they create other problems out of nothing. They’re all down there on the ground level just breeding drama. Almost all of the other hospital staff look down on this department. It’s basically associated with the janitorial department, and the two aren’t considered “real” health care workers, even though they spend all of their time in patients rooms dealing with them directly. Most nurses ignore/won’t speak to dietary staff, or are extremely annoyed when they have to.

review_title: Most Stressful Position I've Ever Experienced
job_title: Registered Nurse in Daytona Beach, FL
pros: Teaching hospital, Cardiologists are exemplary, Team Work Seems to be Slightly Improving, Are able to literally work as much over time as you want, some have literally worked 12 straight shifts, minimum 12 hour shifts, day and night shifts intertwined.
cons: Understaffed, health insurance very expensive and your co-pays and medications are high, management VERY unprofessional (will literally curse you out, screaming with expletives, mainly f bombs without sufficient reason), you're just another warm body, not a caring nor compassionate environment, very poor pay and benefits overall, frequent paycheck discrepancies without compensation, cannot access schedule outside of work, frequent major pharmacy mistakes, poor scheduling, charge nurses do not jump in when staff is drowning, no work/life balance, have to sell your soul to use any PTO. They'll hire you for a specific position in order to draw you in, only to shortly thereafter place you on another unit that was not agreed upon. Management VERY clique and if you do not want to be part of that or grovel at their feet, you get the worst assignments. If you're a caring, competent and caring nurse, you do literally, EVERYTHING, including staying on top of the Doctors responsibilities. Basically, most of the staff have said that this job has made us into people that we are typically not, exhausted, miserable, unhappy, stressed, angry, depressed, anxious, new health issues, no sleep, etc. That it's changed us all in the most negative way possible.

review_title: Good for experience, bad for pay & WLB
job_title: Hospital Unit Clerk in Daytona Beach, FL
pros:
It was a great entry-level, 0-experience-required way to learn about the hospital environment and healthcare field. I used my time there to determine whether a career in nursing would be right for me. It was not.
Shifts are 12 hours long, so full-time employment means only working 3 days per week.
cons: Terrible work/life balance (WLB). We were constantly understaffed (intentionally, to keep labor costs down) and asked to pick up OT for little or no incentives. Favoritism was RAMPANT and promises from management (re: things like specific required scheduling, your place on the 'waiting list' to switch between day/night shift) were never kept unless you threatened to quit.

pros:

Good Health Benefits
cons: Currently, the people that works in this department are very slow in getting work done. That because they prioritize other unimportant things above their responsibilities. Basically, they get too much freedom to do whatever they want without repercussions. They act like they know everything because they have been working the same job for years. They find every opportunity to do everything possible to push the new and incoming workers out so they can continue running this department into the ground. They refuse to change and listen to the supervisor. They do what they want because they are set in their ways, which is disastrous. For example: They take forever on one task, so they don’t have to do anything else. Most of the people that working in this department are older and have health issues that make it difficult, but not impossible to contribute and be a efficient worker, but yet they use every excuse in the book to not have to contribute nothing to the company. They are only there to collect a paycheck and work less. The old folks find every excuse not to work as hard as the younger workers. The older folks have been working there so long they know how to do less work and start many of the gossips. They make work miserable and toxic. The supervisor have favorites that she gives all the hours and first dibs. Supervisor also disclose personal and confidential information to her favorites.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Daytona Beach, FL
pros: The pay and benefits are excellent.  There are numerous different healthcare disciplines represented and the capability exists for this to be one of the best hospitals in the southeastern United States.  Patients are never turned away due to lack of money.  There is a fair sense of teamwork among employees on the floor, sometimes due to being good people, sometimes due to banding together for common defense against the management.
cons: The management.  Promotion and retention are obviously based not on competent performance but on who panders the best, thus the inept,the lazy, and the amoral receive preferential treatment.  Their attitude toward employees is that is you disagree with us, go elsewhere, with no consideration that competent professionals who are not in management might have some valid ideas sometimes.  The stated cultural objectives of the institution sound good to talk about but are very orwellian in their actual practice.  Patients are accepted even if they are indigent but whether they receive equal care consideration from the management or not is open to discussion.

review_title: The worst employer I have ever worked for
job_title: Receptionist in Daytona Beach, FL
pros: The friends that I made there. And that is about it.
cons: Where do I begin? This is the worst company that I have ever worked for. They do not care about their employees. Lowest pay in the county and they DONT give raises. Oh wait.. they give 2% which turns out to be a few cents. Never in all my life have I worked for such a disorganized and backwards company. Stay FAR away from this company. Don’t expect bonuses. The insurance is ridiculous. The worst insurance plan in the county and you’ll pay about half your check for it. Run run run run away from this chaotic mess of a place of employment. I couldn’t take it any more and had to leave, my new job pays double what I made here.

job_title: CNA in Daytona Beach, FL
pros: I work with wonderful, caring, compassionate people who are good leaders and great teachers.  It's a job that fills the soul... and that's about it.
cons: Unfortunately, it's also a job that will never keep a roof over your head.  As the title states it's all about the money or, more precisely, the lack of it.  RNs, LPNs and CNAs out in the field don't make enough to cover bills  so a great majority are forced to have to work second and third jobs.

review_title: Understaffed, underpayed however the people you work with are amazing.
job_title: Dialysis Registered Nurse in Daytona Beach, FL
pros: Compared to hospitals nearby who pay a dollar or two more Halifax is much less corporate and is like working with a big family. Thats what keeps me there.
cons: Due to being a publix hospital nurses generally get paid less and Halifax does not turn down anyone due to financial, socioeconomic status or being a raging addict. this is a both a huge con due to some of the noncompliant addict patient you recieve but is also rewarding when you are able to help a geniune lower status person who would not get care elsewhere.

review_title: So many problems not enough space to type
job_title: Nurse (RN) in Daytona Beach, FL
pros: Halifax is the largest hospital in the county. This can mean greater freedom to switch departments, great learning opportunities because of the patient variety and acuity level (Level II Trauma Center). There are some great, skilled people working there.
cons: The pay is very poor and the health insurance benefits are an expensive joke. There are managers in place that not only are not cut out to be in management they are so unprofessional I can't fathom how they were hired in the first place. Morale is low some nurses are down-right hostile, short-staffing is common. When there is a problem with a single employee on a floor, a whole floor meeting is called to address "the floor's problem", instead of simply counseling said employee. On Medical-Surgical floors the patient to nurse ratio is 6 to 1 (days) 7 to 1 (nights)

review_title: Executive team is  destroying the organization
job_title: Operations Manager in Daytona Beach, FL
pros: Frontline workers truly do care for their patients and work extremely hard to meet the needs of their patients and work hard together as a team.
cons: Human resources department has a reputation throughout the organization as being the last place and employee should go to to get help.  Senior and executive of management continue to ignore sound leadership principles. They are so far behind in technology that they are now paying millions and penalties to the government because they did not invest in technology when they should have. So now they are laying off employees and won't pay what it takes to survive and make a living wage in this county. It is hard to understand why no one takes a hard look at how poorly the executive team has led the organization over the last few years.  What other business allows a leadership team to stay in power with such horrific patient satisfaction survey results?

job_title: Procedure Technician in Daytona Beach, FL
pros:
Family oriented group of individuals that provide excellent care for patients. I had a great time working with these people and hope the work environment has not changed.

The position that I had was an introductory opportunity into the medical field. Knowing this, OR team members around me helped direct my career. I used the lessons learned in the OR as a stepping stone to enhance my career path.

 Also, I always speak highly of the operating room manager (current Chief Surgical Services Officer). She's the best of the best.
cons: The only negative experiences that I have encountered were with panicked/power hungry RNs. However, in any OR setting you will experience this behavior and I believe that different places are far worse.

review_title: Overall, good experience working for Halifax
job_title: Secretary in Daytona Beach, FL
pros: I was hired at 60 years old and worked for 10 years before retiring.  So they must not have an age discrimination thing going on.  I enjoyed my time with the company but worked hard for the money and think I did a good job. Good benefits but those got less and less as years passed.
cons: A lot of inside politics and hiring of friends and relatives who came in and were placed ahead of "old timers" in title and pay.

review_title: A great start for a career - but not a place to stay and establish a satisfying one.
job_title: Coding Specialist II in Daytona Beach, FL
pros: This is a truly large and impressive hospital. As a coder, I was exposed to a variety of areas and specialties, and learned a lot in my time there.
cons: Poor leadership. Little to no recognition for the job you do. Low reimbursement for the job description, and expected productivity. A 'bonus' that is continually just out of reach because the levels are unreasonable.

job_title: Staff RN in Daytona Beach, FL
pros: The people I work with are some of the best I've ever met. Great, incredibly smart nurses who love their patients and work great as a team. Benefits are honestly pretty good.
cons: Not my direct management, but upper management. Administration tries to micromanage staff with 0 experience in a bedside position. Pay is insulting. Staffing ratios are incredibly unsafe (6-7:1 med/surg, 2-3:1 surgical/trauma ICU, 2-3:1 medical ICU). med/surg will work with a maximum of 4 CNAs if they are VERY lucky. Have experienced nights with only 1 CNA. Have worked shifts without a unit clerk or charge RN.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Daytona Beach, FL
pros: For the most part, everyone gets along well.
cons: Career growth seems to be frowned upon even though administration states they support it. Instead of wanting to work with employees, we get pushed away. If you have a problem you really do not have anyone in HR to talk to about the issue as your position will be affected.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Daytona Beach, FL
pros: As a level II trauma center and a teaching hospital there was no lack of excitement and disciplines from in which to learn. Very supportive coworkers.
cons: Management not open to suggestions on potential improvements. When very important (safety) issues are brought to the attention of the manager you are seen as a trouble maker. A few very unsafe nurses are allowed to continue working even when concerns have been discussed.

job_title: Analyst in Daytona Beach, FL
pros: The people are great and it is a very stable place to work
cons: Adverse to change... of you are a cage rattler this is not the place for you. They do not invest in the business  as much as competition.

review_title: Dishonest, dirty, you will regret working here.
job_title: Multiple Positions in Daytona Beach, FL
pros: If you can manage to show up on time most days, you can work here forever, even if you’re incompetent at your job.
cons: They require a 30 day notice to pay out your accumulated paid leave. They know 30 days instead of 2 weeks is likely to cost people job opportunities. This is their idea of retention and an example of their overall view of employees. Management is bad at nearly every level. Favoritism and nepotism are common. Good employees are taken advantage of to cover for the numerous bad employees.

review_title: This hospital is on the decline.
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Daytona Beach, FL
pros: There are so many great employees working here that go above and beyond.  They are willing to help their fellow employees.  I learned a great deal about healthcare operations.
cons: Nothing but a boys club.  Very low employee morale.  Hardest workers are not recognized for their hard work.  There is so much money wasted that should be going to the employees.

review_title: I've had a great experience with Halifax Health. It depends on your attitude. Great place to work.
job_title: CNA in Daytona Beach, FL
pros: Great teamwork and awesome coworkers. The atmosphere is good and everyone wants to help the patients feel better.
cons: The pay could be better. More bonuses, more ways to be more profitable and get raises often. People would stay.

job_title: Clerical in Daytona Beach, FL
pros: location is great. Access to doctors is good.
cons:
Middle and upper management are not interested in the employees under them. They are looking out for themselves and their larger than needed pay scale. New hires are hired in at the same wage as the loyal employees that have been there for 10 years. I know for a fact. One  manger didn't know how to do e-mail and sent out a mass e-mailing to t he effect. Employees had to tell her of her error. Go figure. If management does not like you, your not a favorite and do not fit in with what they think, you are outcast. Private party e-mails sent out to dept. and the manager is friends with person and managers hang around with their employees. Too many times long term employees caught doing their banking on company time and company computers. Management aware, turned their heads. The hard working employees work while the go old boys club have a good time in dept. instead of working. Ever wonder why the dept. has so many accounts outstanding?? Need to have all employees held accountable to the same standards and work ethic. Sloppy dressing mangers hired in that employees have to train.

Middle management  gossips and employees are allowed to gossip about medical records of people they know. When bring this to employee attention to not do this, the employees go to management and lie to cover up . retaliation is really used there. 

Doctors have several large conference rooms while employees work in mold and dirty dusty areas.  Restrooms never stocked with toilet paper and dirt is encrusted on ceiling vents and walls in corners.

job_title: in Daytona Beach, FL
pros: The company is located in Sunny Daytona Beach and just had a new facility built.  This facility is one of the largest in the state.
cons: Constant political struggles with leadership over doing what is right for the company rather than our vendors and certain departments.

job_title: R N in Daytona Beach, FL
pros: Wonderful team members, exciting fast paced environment, and new things every day.
cons: Lying, cheating upper management. Department of Justice involvement with massive fine that falls on the taxpayers since this is a public hospital.

job_title: RN Case Manager in Daytona Beach, FL
pros: Great team environment for nurses. Everyone is always willing to help out. Most doctors are good to work with.
cons: Pay is not great, nurses start at about $20.50/hr. Staffing is always an issue on the floors, nurses are pushed for quick discharges.

review_title: at least I met some awesome people
job_title: Clerical in Daytona Beach, FL
pros:
-The people I worked with 
- meeting new people
cons: Absolutely no room for advancement. They under pay their employees but the funny part is, they think they are over paying you. The upper management is chaotic and all they care about is appearence and not their employees.

job_title: Sterile Processing in Daytona Beach Shores, FL
pros: Great company to work for.  They try hard to make sure everyone is happy and enjoys their job.  HR Department has everything together to help you quickly.
cons: Cafeteria food is terrible and they are only open during the day so if you work at night and forget to pack your lunch be prepared to eat from a vending machine.

job_title: RN CDU in Daytona Beach, FL
pros: Close to home and wide variety of patients
cons: TERRIBLE management and upper level management.  Pay is less than local competitor

review_title: It's good if you don't mind running!
job_title: Patient Care Technician
pros: Competitive pay, decent benefits except the health insurance. Great nurses, and fantastic for RN new grads. They always help each other and there is great teamwork.
cons: Very dated equipment (i.e., bedside tables that don't roll), sometimes short staffing, but they try to staff adequately. Schedules made 6 weeks in advance.

job_title: Mental Health Tech in Daytona Beach, FL
pros: This company has interest in keeping people for the long haul. They will help you further your education and career. Every one complains about pay, but I feel I get paid well for what I do.
cons: Great team support but division between departments and areas.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Daytona Beach, FL
pros: Great teamwork, friendly environment, good benefits
cons: They pay nurses less than other hospitals in the area but still manage to give physician bonuses. Time for a re-evaluation of priorities if you ask me. Nurses are the backbone of an institution and should be treated as such.

review_title: Too many cooks in the kitchen
